results.title: Planning and goal setting: time waste or management tool
results.creator_credit: Pare Lorentz Jr, Fred H Joiner, Ameron and BNA Communications
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Manager and the Organization”.
Explores the advantages and disadvantages of economic forecasts and business plans, various practicalities and difficulties to overcome and how to overcome them. Also considers the costs and benefits of planning yourself, or out-sourcing professional planners.

results.title: The Magic Boomerang
results.brief_description: A series made for children’s television. Set in a country town with a boy hero “Nuggett” who becomes involved in many extraordinary adventures.

group_works.title: The Magic boomerang: Double trouble
group_works.creator_credit: David Baker, Roger Mirams and Pacific Films

results.title: The Magic boomerang: Double trouble
results.creator_credit: David Baker, Roger Mirams and Pacific Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Magic Boomerang”.
One of a series made for children’s television. The story is set in a country town where the boy “hero” of the series, Nuggett, gets involved in a plot to defraud a man of some land. The whole plot is thwarted with the help of Nuggett and his friend and the magic boomerang. The owner and his land are saved in a happy ending.

results.title: 330 million gods
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Long Search”.
Ronald Eyre begins his search for the answers to the great philosophical questions of experience in India, home of 330 million gods. He discovers that Hinduism is really a philosophy of life rather than a religion. He visits Benares and a small village to discover what religion means to the ordinary people of India as they perform their daily rituals and celebrate festivals associated with their local deity. Much of the discussion hinges on the meaning of symbols, ritual and what is a God.

results.title: Rome, Leeds and the desert
results.creator_credit: Mischa Scorer, Peter Montagnon and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Long Search”.
In this program Ronald Eyre looks at three aspects of Catholicism; the triumphal pageant of Rome and the Pope, the beliefs of a British convert to Catholicism and her family in Leeds, and finally at the Little Brothers of Jesus who live in small groups in the community, except for the year they spend alone in the desert, and the time they spend training in Spain.

results.title: Loose ends
results.brief_description:
Episode number 13 of Series “The Long Search”.
In this concluding episode Ronald Eyre attempts to answer questions such as “Is religion about theology?”, “Is God dead?”, “Do all religions say the same thing?” In a program filled with such questions and many more personal ones besides, he revisits some of the crucial moments in his search including his visits to Romania, the Buddhist monks and the taoist funeral, concluding that in order to find true religion, one first has to find oneself.

results.title: West meets east
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Stedall, Peter Montagnon and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “The Long Search”.
In this penultimate program Ronald Eyre visits the alternative communities of San Francisco, where westerners are searching for something to replace traditional religion, or the religion of science and progress, which seems to have replaced religion in the accepted sense in much of western society. The fundamental question he asks in this program is “Is God dead and did science kill him, and is science an adequate explanation of reality?” He talks to Theodore Roszak about the quest for meaning, and to noted physicists and philosophers, about the growing indadequacy of science to explain. Touching briefly on various manifestations of this search - biofeedback, sikhism, SAGE and the new physics, he concludes that the search itself is positive, even if the finding is sometimes shallow and negative.

results.title: A Question of balance
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Stedall, Peter Montagnon and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “The Long Search”.
In this visit to Taiwan Ronald Eyre looks at Chinese religion and finds that the Chinese are Confucians, Taoists, Buddhists or can be all three at once. He explores the concept of yin and yan and the harmony which comes when good and evil are combined in balance. He takes his journey from a look at the local gods to the philosophy of the three accepted religions. The three main aims of the Chinese seem to be to live a long time, to have enough money and to have children, and it is from this that the importance of ancestors derive. He attends a village opera performance, a taoist funeral and explores a new temple which seems to include all three religions.
